Package utilities

Class Image

java.lang.Object
utilities.Image
public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
The Image class is used to represent an Image (or frame if you will) that gets projected on the screen by the renderer and is seen by the Camera. Underneath it writes the pixels to the java BufferedImage class.
Author:
Timothy
See Also:
Renderer, Camera

  • Constructor Details

    • Image

      public Image​(int width, int height)
      The Image constructor gets a width and height as parameter and creates an Image with the specified width and height. It also creates a file to write to later and the actual BufferedImage which will contain the data.
      Parameters:
      width - An int value representing the width of the image.
      height - An int value representing the height of the image.
      See Also:
      File, BufferedImage

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write()
      The write method is used to write all the data from the BufferedImage object to the file we created in the constructor of the image object.
      See Also:
      File, BufferedImage

    • draw

      public void draw​(int x, int y, int rgb)
      The draw method is used to give each pixel (specified by the x and y) a rgb color value.
      Parameters:
      x - An int value representing the x coordinate of a pixel.
      y - An int value representing the y coordinate of a pixel.
      rgb - An int value representing the rgb value.
      See Also:
      Color, BufferedImage

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns:
      An int value that represents the width of the Image object.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns:
      An int value that represents the height of the Image object.
